hanzi-su-wiki:
亥

Значения

Время около полуночи. Свинья (знак зодиака). Двенедцатый циклический знак двенадцатиричного цикла "земные ветви".

Мнемоника

  • Около полуночи родители 人 проверяют своих маленьких детей ㄊ (перевёрнутое 子).
  • Искажено. Совокупляющихся люди 人, которые просят у неба (сейчас пишется, как «крыша» 亠) потомства. Означает время от 9 до 11 вечера, наиболее благоприятное для зачатия.

Варианты

玄, 豕, 犭, 㐪, 𠀅
hanzi-su-slides:
亥

亥Верхняя часть ㄊ напоминает перевёрнутого дитя 子. Около полуночи взрослые 人 (снизу) проверяют детей.
hàiОт 9 до 11 ч вечера, год Свиньи
Около полуночи подул хо[ха]лодный ветер.
Конец суток (последний 4-й тон).
purpleculture_pinyin:
hài
12th earthly branch: 9-11 p.m., 10th solar month (7th November-6th December), year of the Boar; ancient Chinese compass point: 330°
12-я земная ветвь: 9-11 часов вечера, 10-й солнечный месяц (7 ноября - 6 декабря), год Кабана; точка компаса древнего Китая: 330 °
rtega_mnemonic:
亥亥RSthe last of 12 terrestrial branches, the hours between 9 and 11 p.m., at night
  • modf. pig 豕 → 亥
purpleculture_examples:
辛亥革命 [ xīn hài gé mìng ]: Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
亥时 [ hài shí ]: 9-11 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
亥猪 [ hài zhū ]: Year 12, year of the Boar (e.g. 2007)
丁亥 [ dīng hài ]: twenty-fourth year D12 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 2007 or 2067
俄亥俄 [ é hài é ]: Ohio

heisig_keyword: sign of the hog | знак свиньи
heisig_chinese_memo: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. Top hat and acorn is the sign of the hog.
heisig_constituent: sign of the hog, acorn, top hat
heisig_story: This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the sign of the hog. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating hog in connection with the primitive meaning given below.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: sign of the hog, 9-11PM, twelfth sign of the Chinese zodiac
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: Знак боров, 9-11PM, двенадцатый знак китайского зодиака
koohiiStory1: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them.
koohiiStory2: Top Hat + Elbow + Person: The sign of the hog was a very recognizable tattoo - a hog with a big grin in a top hat, sticking his elbow into the person next to him.
Ru_Meaning: sign of the hog, 9-11PM, twelfth sign of the Chinese zodiac
Ru_AutoNotes:
Кабан - дикое животное, предок домашней свиньи.

У кабана в японском много похожих названий: イノシシ, イノコ, イ, シシ. В древнеяпонском кабан назывался イ(ウィ), а 猪の肉イののシシ и 猪の子イのこ - это "плоть кабана" и "маленький кабан, кабанчик". Тем не менее, именно イノシシ сейчас используется шире всего.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 猪(い、いのしし、チョ кабан), 豕 (シ свинья), 亥 (い、ガイ знак кабана, 12-й знак китайского зодиака).

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the twisted short thread (幺) with the lid (亠) is the sign of the hog
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. Top hat and acorn is the sign of the hog.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The original meaning of the Jiajin text has not been finalized. Elephant Grass said in a hidden underground (Xu Shen, Linyi Guang, Ye Yusen, Gao Hong Jin, Baiyu Zheng, Sunrise season), " a " like the ground, like at the grass-roots hidden in the underground, is the "roots of plant roots" of " roots of plant beginning" of The text has the meaning of " deep " and " hidden ", which can explain the shape and meaning of the " carving " of " carving " and the "nucleus" of " core ". However, a closer look at the oracle bone inscriptions of the character " Hai " is far from the image of the roots, which is hard to convince. "Said Wen": "Hai, Xian Ye. In October, when the sun is shining, start to receive Sheng Yin. From 𠄞, 𠄞, the ancient Chinese characters. One male, one female. B, like a cough and a cough. "Spring and Autumn Biography" Said: Hai has two heads and six bodies. All the genres of Hai are from Hai. 𢁓, the ancient text Hai is hog, and it is the same as hog. Hai gives birth to sons, and reconciles together."

It is said that " Hai " is an error of the word " Hig " (Yuan Guohua), the character resembles a pig lying on its side, or the words " Hai " and " Hig " in ancient times (Shang Chengzuo, Tang Lan). "Shuowen": "The ancient text "Hai" is hog, which is the same as hog." However, if you compare the character " Hig " with " Hai " in the oracle bone inscriptions, it can be seen that the character of " Hig " is generally characterized by its obvious abdominal lines, and The character "豕" in the bronze inscriptions of the Shang Dynasty is actually an image of a pig. All these are not seen in the word " Hai ". It can be seen that the original meaning of " Hai " is not well understood. It was later borrowed as the twelfth of the Earthly Branches, and the ancients used it to record time (referring to 9 to 11 o'clock in the afternoon), date and year. Ranked last in the Zodiac, it is used to mean " pig ". Wang Chong "Lun Heng. "Physical Situation": "Hai, hog also."

Because " Hai " and " hog -shape" is similar to ancient times often mixed, idioms "Hai Lu hog fish" means " Lu " and " fish ", " Hai " and " hog " shape similar to that caused by misuse wrong reading . Ge Hong "Baopuzi. "Xia Lan": "The proverb says: "Three writings in the book, the fish becomes Lu, and the empty becomes a tiger."" "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Cha Biography": "A reporter who has read history said: "The Jinshi three pigs waded the river." Zixia said: "No, it is Jihai. Husband and Ji are similar to San, and Qi is similar to Hai."" "Yuhaiqi" generally refers to text errors in the publication of books (Chinese Dictionary).

Jia Jinwen and bamboo slips are used as earthly branches, mostly to record the day, "Collection" 1887: "Yihai", which is the day of Yihai. Wang Sun’s survivor’s clock: "Yu (only) Good luck at the beginning of the first month", "Chu Ji" means "Chu Gan Ji Day" (Wang Yinzhi), which is calculated on the basis of ten dry days. The first to tenth day of each month Any day can be called "Chu Ji" (Huang Shengzhang). The whole sentence means the day of Dinghai in the first month. The ancients often used Dinghai as a synonym for auspicious days. Pang Pu pointed out that "Ji Dinghai at the beginning of the first month" was not a memorable expression, but was an auspicious formula at that time. "Baoshan Chujian" 71: "The Day of Xinhai".

The Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period were again called " reform ", "Guodian Slips. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 21: "Shu (independence) does not stand (reform)", which means independent existence without external changes (Liu Zhao). Gu Xi is used as a surname.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The shape of the Jiajin font is inconclusive, and it is suspected to be like grass roots (Xu Shen); one said that it is like a pig, and it is the same character as " hog " (Shang Chengzuo, Tang Lan). It was later borrowed as the twelfth of the Earthly Branches. The Chinese zodiac uses " Hai " as " pig ".
humanum_full_description:
甲金文字形本義未有定論。一說象草根藏於地下（許慎、林義光、葉玉森、高鴻縉、白玉崢、季旭昇），「一」象地面，下象草根藏於地下，是「根荄」的「荄」的初文，有「深」、「藏」之意，從而可說明「刻劃」之「刻」、「核心」之「核」之形構取義。不過，細看「亥」字之甲骨文，與根荄之象相去甚遠，難以令人信服。《說文》：「亥，荄也。十月微陽，起接盛陰。从𠄞，𠄞，古文上字。一人男，一人女也。乙，象褢子咳咳之形。《春秋傳》曰：亥有二首六身。凡亥之屬皆从亥。𢁓，古文亥爲豕，與豕同。亥而生子，復從一起。」

　　一說「亥」是「豕」字之訛誤（袁國華），字象一頭側躺著的豬，或以為古時「亥」、「豕」一字（商承祚、唐蘭）。《說文》：「古文亥爲豕，與豕同。」然而若將甲骨文中的「豕」字與「亥」字相比較，可見「豕」字普遍的特徵在於其明顯的腹部線條，而且商代金文之「豕」字其實是豬的圖像。凡此種種，均「亥」字所未見。可見，「亥」字的構形本義未有很好的說法。後借用為地支第十二位，古人用以紀時（指午後九時至十一時）、紀日、紀年。在十二生肖中排行最末，用來表示「豬」。王充《論衡．物勢》：「亥，豕也。」

　　由於「亥」與「豕」的字形相似，古時常常相混，成語「魯魚亥豕」指「魯」和「魚」、「亥」和「豕」字形相似，以致引起誤寫錯讀。葛洪《抱朴子．遐覽》：「諺曰：『書三寫，魚成魯，虛成虎。』」《呂氏春秋．察傳》：「有讀史記者曰：『晉師三豕涉河。』子夏曰：『非也，是己亥也。夫己與三相近，豕與亥相似。』」後以「魯魚亥豕」泛指書籍傳寫刊印中的文字錯誤（漢語大詞典）。

　　甲金文和竹簡用作地支，多用以紀日，《合集》1887：「乙亥」，即乙亥這一天。王孫遺者鐘：「隹（唯）正月初吉丁亥」，「初吉」即「初干吉日」（王引之），指以十天干來計算，每月第一日至第十日中的任何一天，都可稱為「初吉」（黃盛璋）。全句意謂正月丁亥這一天。古人常用丁亥爲吉日之代稱，龐樸指出「正月初吉丁亥」，非記實之辭，乃當時吉祥之套語。《包山楚簡》71：「辛亥之日」。

　　戰國竹簡又通假為「改」，《郭店簡．老子甲》簡21：「蜀（獨）立不亥（改）」，意謂獨立存在不受外界的改變（劉釗）。古璽用作姓氏。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文字形未有定論，疑象草根（許慎）；一說象豬，古與「豕」同字（商承祚、唐蘭）。後借用為地支第十二位，古人用以紀時（午後九時至十一時）、紀日、紀年。十二生肖以「亥」為「豬」。

Heisig constituents: sign of the hog, acorn, top hat
Heisig: This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the sign of the hog. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating hog in connection with the primitive meaning given below.
* The top hat represents the external shape of the acorn, and the unusual but easily written complex of strokes beneath it (which you might also see as distortions of an elbow and person) stands for the mysterious secret whereby the acorn contains the oak tree in a nutshell.
Chinese: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. Top hat and acorn is the sign of the hog.
koohii1: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them.
koohii2: Top Hat + Elbow + Person: The sign of the hog was a very recognizable tattoo - a hog with a big grin in a top hat, sticking his elbow into the person next to him.
Meaning: sign of the hog
Story: A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. Top hat and acorn is the sign of the hog.
Kind: both

Wang Sun’s survivor’s clock: "Yu (only) Good luck at the beginning of the first month", "Chu Ji" means "Chu Gan Ji Day" (Wang Yinzhi), which is calculated on the basis of ten dry days. The first to tenth day of each month Any day can be called "Chu Ji" (Huang Shengzhang). The whole sentence means the day of Dinghai in the first month. The ancients often used Dinghai as a synonym for auspicious days. Pang Pu pointed out that "Ji Dinghai at the beginning of the first month" was not a memorable expression, but was an auspicious formula at that time. "Baoshan Chujian" 71: "The Day of Xinhai". The Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period were again called " reform", "Guodian Slips. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 21: "Shu (independence) does not stand (reform)", which means independent existence without external changes (Liu Zhao). Gu Xi is used as a surname.

亥字的基本解释

亥
hài
地支的末一位，属猪。
用于计时：亥时（晚九点至十一点）。

亥字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hài］
［《廣韻》胡改切，上海，匣。］
(1)草根。
(2)地支的第十二位。古代与太岁纪年法相配，用以纪年。《尔雅·释天》：“太歲在寅曰攝提格……在戌曰閹茂，在亥曰大淵獻。”亦用以纪月，纪日。
(3)十二时辰之一。指午后九时至十一时。
(4)古代阴阳五行家将十二地支和四方相配，子在正北，卯在正东，午在正南，酉在正西。亥在酉、子之间而偏于子，于位为西北偏北方向。
(5)十二生肖以亥为猪。
(6)指七十三岁。
(7)通“其”。
(8)姓。春秋时晋国有亥唐。见《孟子·万章下》。
[②]［jiē］
见“亥2市”。

亥字的康熙字典解释

【子集上】【亠字部】　亥； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页88第08
【唐韻】【正韻】胡改切【集韻】【韻會】下改切，?音頦。辰名。【爾雅·釋天】太歲在亥曰大淵獻。【前漢·律歷志】該閡於亥。【唐書·禮樂志】吉亥祀先農。【元史·祭祀志】黑帝位亥。　又姓。晉亥唐。　又豕亥。【家語】或讀史云：三豕渡河。子夏曰：已亥渡河，已譌爲三，亥譌爲豕。校之，果然。【左傳·襄三十年】史趙曰：亥有二首六身。【註】亥字，二畫在上，幷三人爲身，如算之六。　又亥市。【通雅】靑箱雜記，蜀有亥市，亥音皆，言如痎瘧，閒日一發也。諱痎，故云亥市。【徐筠水志】荆吳俗，取寅申巳亥日集於市。　又【韻補】叶許已切，音喜。【易林】將戌繫亥，陽藏不起。君子散亂，太上危殆。殆音以。

亥字的源字形

亥字的起名意思

：本义指猪，旧时指夜里九点到十一。

Hai
Basic explanation of words
Hai
hi
The last of the earthly branches is a pig.
Used for timing: Haishi (from nine o'clock to eleven o'clock in the evening).
Hai
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hài］
["Guangyun" Hu Gaiqi, Shanghai, Xia. ]
(1) Grassroots.
(2) The twelfth place of the Earthly Branch. In ancient times, it matched the Tai Sui chronology and used it to record the years. "Erya·Shitian": "Tai Sui is in Yinyue to capture the tige... In Xuyue, Eunmao, in Haiyue Dayuan." It is also used to record the moon and the sun.
(3) One of twelve o'clock. Refers to from 9 o'clock to 11 o'clock in the afternoon.
(4) The ancient yin and yang five elements matched the twelve earthly branches with the four directions, with the child being in the north, the mao in the east, the noon in the south, and the unity in the west. Hai is between You and Zi and is biased towards Zi, and Yu is in the north-northwest direction.
(5) The Chinese zodiac uses Hai as the pig.
(6) Refers to seventy-three years old.
(7) Link "其".
(8) Last name. In the Spring and Autumn Period, Jin State had the Haitang. See "Mencius · Ten Thousand Chapters".
[②]［jiē］
See "Hai 2 City".
Hai

[Tang Shu·Li Yue Zhi] Jihai worshipped Xiannong. [Yuan History · Sacrifice History] The Black Emperor is Hai.　Another last name. Jinhaitang.　Yihai again. [Home language] Or read Shi Yun: Three hogs crossing the river. Zi Xia said: Hai has crossed the river, has been three, and Hai has been hog. Of the school, sure enough. [Thirty Years of Zuo Zhuan·Xiang] Shi Zhaoyue: Hai has two poems and six bodies. [Note] The word "Hai" is painted on the top, and the three of them are the same as the sixth.　Youhai City. [Tongya] Miscellaneous notes on the box, Shu has the city of Hai, and the sounds of Hai are all. The words are like malaria, and they can be heard in leisure days. Taboo, therefore Yunhai City. [Xu Yun Shui Zhi] Jing Wu custom, took the Yin Shen Sihai day and set it at the market.　[Rhyme Filling] Ye Xu has already cut, Yinxi. [Yi Lin] Put Xu to the Hai, but Yang can't hide it. Hai
Name meaning
: The original meaning refers to pig, but in the old days it refers to nine to eleven at night.
亥
亥 hai
原来的字义是“猪”。字形象
一头猪,上端的短横是头;中间是
圆圆的背脊线;腿、尾俱全。后来
本义不存,只从亥的生肖为系
(猪)可以看出来。
万可文亥东文
Хай
Хай Хай
Первоначальное значение - «свинья».
Изображение персонажа - свинья, верхняя черта - голова, середина - круглая линия спины, ноги и хвост завершены.
Позже первоначального значения не существует, можно увидеть только из зодиака Хай (свинья).
Ван Кэ Вен Хай Донг Вен
hài, [c][i]в, coчeт., тakжe[/c], [c][/i][/c]gāi
I усл.
1) хай, двенадцатый циклический знак из двенадцати земных ветвей; 12-й (по порядку)
2) знак Свиньи; год Свиньи (при обозначении лет циклическими знаками)
他属亥 он родился в год Свиньи
3) десятый месяц (по лунному календарю); декабрь (по солнечному)
4) время от 9 до 11 часов вечера
5) Рыбы (при обозначении знаков зодиака циклическими знаками)
6) северо-западная треть северной четверти лимба; ССЗ
7) кит. муз. 12-я ступень хроматического звукоряда (см. 应钟)
8) расцвет женской силы (阴 инь) при скрытом состоянии мужской силы (阳 ян)
II сущ.
* свинья
III собств.

亠 (крышка), 人 (человек)

Кабан - дикое животное, предок домашней свиньи.

У кабана в японском много похожих названий: イノシシ, イノコ, イ, シシ. В древнеяпонском кабан назывался イ(ウィ), а 猪の肉イののシシ и 猪の子イのこ - это "плоть кабана" и "маленький кабан, кабанчик". Тем не менее, именно イノシシ сейчас используется шире всего.

Сравни: 猪(い、いのしし、チョ кабан), 豕 (シ свинья), 亥 (い、ガイ знак кабана, 12-й знак китайского зодиака).
